p: The inoculum consists of 0.02 mL of undiluted or 1:10–1:50 of diluted sample in culture medium or phosphate buffer saline (PBS) plus antibiotics and 2% fetal calf serum. Animals should be observed for at least 2–3 weeks. Rapid identification is achieved by indirect immunofluorescent assay, using dengue hyperimmune ascitic fluid, specific dengue mAbs, by RT/PCR or by neutralization assay.
